edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.time

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.time.Scheduler

  • public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles time in the simulation by maintaining a priority queue of Events, prioritized by time and then by priority for Events scheduled to happen in the same tick.

    Event is an inner class that contains

    • an Action
    • an Actor
    • an Integer that denotes the scheduled event time.
    Author:
    ram

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Scheduler.Event
      An Event is the execution of a Action, by an Actor, at a point in time.

    • Field Detail

      • events

        private java.util.PriorityQueue<Scheduler.Event> events
        Priority Queue of Events sorted by time and priority of Actions.

        All Events are sorted by their scheduled time (when) with Events scheduled earlier (smaller when) happening before Events scheduled later (larger when).

        Events scheduled to happen at the same time are sorted by the priority of their Actions hence Events whose Actions (what) have higher priority are completed before others.

        Events scheduled to happen at the same time with same priority in their Actions complete in arbitrary order.

        See Also:
        Event#compareTo(Event)}

      • now

        private int now
        Stores the current time of the World. Zero(0) to start with

      • ticksize

        private int ticksize
        The amount of time that should elapse between polls of this Scheduler. Smallest should be 1.

      • universe

        private World universe
        The World for which this Scheduler passes time, i.e. the World to be ticked

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scheduler

        public Scheduler(int ticksize,
                 World w)
        Sets the tickSize and instantiates the events queue.
        Parameters:
        ticksize - the amount of time to be elapsed for each tick
        w - the World to be ticked
        See Also:
        #ticksize}, #events}, #world}

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public void schedule(ActionInterface c,
                     Actor<?> a,
                     int duration)
        Schedules an Action by adding an Event to the queue of events (events).
        Parameters:
        c - the Action to be scheduled
        a - the actor of the Action or Event. The Actor may be null in the case of simulations that allow the world to change automatically.
        duration - of the Event (how long it takes for the event to complete)
        See Also:
        #events}

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Allow time to pass. Process any Events that are scheduled to go off between now and the next time tick (now + ticksize) in the order of the priority.

      • lossSchedule

        public void lossSchedule(MessageRenderer m)
        Scheduler schedules a loss event and instantiates the losing sequence defined by the losing action of the game.
        Parameters:
        m - The messagerenderer that will handle message display for the loss
        See Also:
        #events}

      • winSchedule

        public void winSchedule(MessageRenderer m)
        Scheduler schedules a winning event and instantiates the win sequence defined by the winning action of the game.
        Parameters:
        m - The messagerenderer that will handle message display for the win
        See Also:
        #events}
